title: Support local-only mode without remote sync
description:
Add support for local-only bookmark storage without requiring GitHub authentication or remote repository. This would allow users to use WebTags purely for local bookmark organization with tags, without the sync feature.

## Requirements
- Allow extension to work without initializing a GitHub repository
- Store bookmarks.json locally in browser storage or local filesystem
- Provide UI to toggle between local-only and sync modes
- All tagging and bookmark management features should work in local mode
- Optional: Allow upgrading from local-only to sync mode later

## Benefits
- Lower barrier to entry for new users
- Useful for users who don't want/need GitHub sync
- Allows testing extension without GitHub setup
- Privacy-focused option for users who prefer local-only storage

title: Add fine-grained PAT authentication support
description:
Implement authentication using GitHub fine-grained Personal Access Tokens for repository-specific access.

## Background
OAuth 'repo' scope grants access to ALL repositories, which is a security concern. Fine-grained PATs allow access to specific repositories only.

## Requirements
- Support fine-grained PAT in Auth message handler
- Store PAT securely in keychain
- Validate PAT and check it has required permissions
- UI to input PAT in extension
- Documentation for creating fine-grained PAT with correct scopes

## Permissions Needed
- Repository: Contents (Read and write)
- Only for the webtags-bookmarks repository

## References
- GitHub docs: https://docs.github.com/en/authentication/keeping-your-account-and-data-secure/managing-your-personal-access-tokens#creating-a-fine-grained-personal-access-token
- Already have PAT auth method in code, just needs fine-grained support

title: Complete OAuth device flow with token polling
description:
The OAuth device flow currently only starts the flow and returns device code, but doesn't poll for the access token after user authorizes.

## Current State
- `handle_auth` with OAuth method returns device code
- No message handler to poll for token completion
- Extension would need to manually poll

## Needed
- Add new Message type: `PollToken { device_code: String, interval: u64 }`
- Handler that polls GitHub until token is received or timeout
- Store token in keychain after successful authorization
- Return success/error to extension

## Alternative
- Could make OAuth handler poll automatically, but would block for up to 15 minutes
- Message-based approach is cleaner for async operations

## Note
With fine-grained PAT support (project-webtags-5sp), OAuth may be less critical
